original_solution_mapping.L1: Before her sister took some there were 64/4=<<64/4=16>>16 apples in each basket
original_solution_mapping.L2: After her sister took some each pile had 16-3=<<16-3=13>>13 apples in each basket

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1277.
    Returns: the number of apples in each basket now.
    """
    # L1
    total_apples = 64 # Jane picked 64 apples
    num_baskets = 4 # sorted them into 4 different baskets
    apples_per_basket_initial = total_apples / num_baskets

    # L2
    apples_taken_per_basket = 3 # her sister took 3 apples from each of the baskets
    apples_per_basket_final = apples_per_basket_initial - apples_taken_per_basket

    # FA
    answer = apples_per_basket_final
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Before her sister took some there were {total_apples}/{num_baskets}=<<{total_apples}/{num_baskets}={apples_per_basket_initial}>>{apples_per_basket_initial} apples in each basket

After her sister took some each pile had {apples_per_basket_initial}-{apples_taken_per_basket}=<<{apples_per_basket_initial}-{apples_taken_per_basket}={apples_per_basket_final}>>{apples_per_basket_final} apples in each basket

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Before her sister took some there were 64/4=<<64/4=60>>60 apples in each basket
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After her sister took some each pile had 60-3=<<60-3=57>>57 apples in each basket

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '-' instead.
